She is asking for a financial assistance of PHP 9000 to buy bananas, oils, sugar, vegetables, meat and other ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell. She believes that her loan will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oils, sugar, vegetables, meat and other ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es un joven de 27 años, quien es soltero y vive en  Sololá junto a su madre, y sus 5 hermanos (3 hombres y 2 mujeres). El actualmente elabora cortes típicos que son prendas que las mujeres utilizan en la comunidad donde vive. Los productos los vende en el mercado  de Sololá, con ello genera ingresos aceptables que le ayudan a aportar a la economía familiar. El tiene una experiencia de 8 años en esta labor,  la cual la  aprendió a través de unos amigos. Con el paso del tiempo el ha comprado poco a poco todas las herramientas necesarias para hacer este trabajo; El solicita un préstamo de Q, 3,000.00 para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de cortes típicos. Unos de  sus sueños es comprar una máquina industrial que le ayude a entregar los productos completos en menor tiempo y con mayor calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Francisco is a young man of 27 years of age. He's single and lives in Sololá with his mother and his 5 siblings (3 brothers and 2 sisters). He currently weaves traditional garments, which are clothing worn by the women in the village where he lives. He sells his products in the market of Sololá, and that's how he earns acceptable profits which help him to contribute to his family's finances. He has 8 years' worth of experience in this line of work, which he learned from some of his friends. Over time, he has gradually acquired all the tools he needs to do this work. He requests a loan of 3000 quetzal in order to purchase supplies for making traditional garments. One of his dreams is to buy an industrial machine which helps him to deliver the completed products faster and with higher quality to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making traditional garments.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is married and a single mother of two grown-up children. San is one of Cambodia's Muslims who currently lives in Reussey Keo district, Phnom Penh. At her age of 59, San is an industrious housewife, always taking care of her children and working for a healthy family. Her family’s income depends on her two children; her daughter, who is a garment worker, and her son, who provides tuk-tuk services around the city.

Due to insufficient capital for building a house, San is seeking a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), a long-standing Kiva partner, to buy needed materials for housing construction. Just for a suitable shelter, it is going to cost USD 1,500. This loan will help prevent her family from paying a higher rent for a room and will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy needed materials for housing construction.

loans.name: Ishumael

texts.en: Ishumael is an eighty-six-year-old dryland farmer. He grows maize and peas, and keeps goats and chickens. Ishumael has forty acres, which he would someday like to cover with trees. However, this season, he will be adding a second KOMAZA tree farm to his agricultural investments. Ishumael plans to use the profits from his tree farm to upgrade from his mud-walled home.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: This client, named Mao, is 31 years old and a resident living in a public gathering area of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She started doing farming when she was a teenage girl living with her parents. She has learned the methodology of operating the business for more than 10 years and she earns approximately USD 1.50 per day. Working around 8-10 hours at a construction site, Mao’s husband is able to make USD 5.00 a day to financially support their family and keep their two children in school. Mao’s husband is planning to work in Thailand for a better wage; however, he doesn’t have enough money to pay for a passport and also for traveling expenses. In this regard, Mao decided to borrow a loan through HKL to solve their financial problems and work out their plans. In the future, Mao dreams of having a nice house and giving her children good opportunities for education.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and also for traveling expenses.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es: Alba con su credikiva pasado incrementó sus ventas, por eso ahora tiene mas demanda de los articulos que ofrece y está cumpliendo a  los pedidos que hacen en muchos de los pueblos vecinos. Sin embargo desde otros municipios hay muchas solicitudes y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responderles, por eso acude una vez mas a su credikiva, con el cual aumentará el número de tanques metálicos y plásticos para obtener buenos precios y responder efectivamente a la demanda de su mercado.
texts.en: With her last Kiva loan Alba increased her sales, and for this reason she now has more demand for the articles she sells and is receiving orders from many neighboring town. Nevertheless there are many orders from neighboring towns and her working capital is not sufficient to meet them. For this reason she is asking for another Kiva loan, with which she will increase the number of metal and plastic tanks she has to obtain good prices and  successfully respond to the demand for her goods.

loans.use: to buy metal and plastic tanks to sell in neighboring towns.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Antonio le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesaria para la compra de material. Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su empleo.
El señor Juan Antonio y su esposa Sara son originarios de esta ciudad y tiene dos hijos y pronto llegaran dos integrantes mas a la familia. El señor Juan Antonio trabaja para una compañía de construcción y también realiza trabajos de a otras personas de albañilería y la señora Sara se dedica al cuidado y atender sus hijos.
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo será para pagar el crédito, y con el ingreso que obtiene de otros trabajos es para los gastos familiares.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia y que estén en las mejores condiciones y así también evitar enfermedades.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio’s house lacks ceramic floor tiles, but he does not have the money he needs to buy the material.  He is requesting a loan to make that purchase.  He will take care of making the improvement by working additional hours at his job.

Juan Antonio and his wife, Sara, are from this city.  He has two children, and soon two more members of the family will arrive.

Juan Antonio works for a construction company.  He also does other bricklaying jobs for other people.  Sara devotes herself to looking after and taking care of their children.

He will use the salary he receives from his job to repay the loan.  The income that he gets from other jobs is for the family expenses.

He wishes to improve his family’s heritage, and he wants it to be in better condition.  That way they will also avoid illnesses.

loans.use: to put down ceramic floor tiles.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: This time, for her fourth cycle loan, Arsenia is requesting a loan Php 14000 in order to fund her rope-making business.  This business was previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF and it continues to provide Arsenia and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 61 years-old and widowed with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a banana farm. She has been in her business for over 10 years and earns PHp19,000 every month. 

In 2009, she joined Kiva partner GDMPC and she is now requesting a loan of PHp21,500 in order to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use 
the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Yvelina

texts.es:
Yvelina es propietaria de un Salón de Belleza que tiene 2 años operando en un local cerca de su casa. Además de dar servicio de lavado y secado de pelo, Yvelina vende ropas y accesorios de plata a los clientes que visitan su salón de belleza. Yvelina solicita un monto de 20,000 pesos con lo que podrá mejorar el local y agregar otros equipos para un mejor servicio. Los salones de belleza pequeños de la zona cobran unos 80 pesos por lavado y secado usando los productos del salón; hay mucha demanda de este servicio ya que por lo regular las mujeres van al salón 1 vez por semana pero así mismo hay mucha oferta y competencia. Por esta razón ella quiere tener más espacio y comodidad, y también agregar otros servicios.

Yvelina tiene 29 años y vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, uno de 14, otro de 10 y un bebe de 7 meses. En el futuro quisiera tener su casa propia y asegurar el bienestar de su familia, está confiada en que este préstamo en un gran paso para lograr su  meta.
texts.en:
Yvelina is the owner of a beauty salon that she has operated for two years in a place near her house.  In addition to washing and drying hair, Yvelina sells clothing and silver accessories to her customers in the beauty salon.

Yvelina's requesting a loan for 20,000 pesos [DOP] to be able to improve her shop and add other equipment for better service.

The small beauty salons in the area charge 80 pesos for a wash and dry using salon products.  There's a lot of demand for this service because women usually go to the salon once a week, so there are a lot of sales and competition.  This is why she wants to have more space and comfort, as well as add services.

Yvelina, 29, lives with her partner and her three children, ages 14, 10, and 7 months.  She would like to have her own house in the future and secure her family's well-being.  She's confident that this loan is a big step towards achieving her goal.

loans.use: to improve the structure of her business

loans.name: Mario Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. Mario es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, está casado y tiene 2 hijos. El trabaja en una maquiladora conocida en la ciudad. Desde hace ya varios años el poco a poco ha ido construyendo su casa; cuenta con un poco de material pero no el suficiente para poder terminar de construirla. El necesita el apoyo por medio de kiva para poder comprar más mercancía y así terminar de construir y arreglar varios detalles que tiene su vivienda. Aparte del estudio el  Sr. Mario comenta que quiere dejarles un bue patrimonio a su esposa y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario is a very hard-working and responsible man. Her is married and has 2 children. He works in a well-known assembly plant. 

For many years now he has been slowly building his house. He has some material but it is insufficient to finish building it. He needs the support of Kiva to buy more materials and in this way finish building and see to the finishing details of his home. 

In addition to education Mario wants to leave his wife and children a good inheritance.

loans.use: to finish building his home.

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantuya, 52 years-old, lives with her father, sister and son in Erdenet the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). Her father is retired and receives a state pension. Her younger sister has been working at a private business since 2007 and, from 2013, she has been promoted to the position of accountant. Mrs. Gantuya herself has been working as a chemistry teacher at a school for 29 years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her son is unemployed and now stays at home. 

Even though the family owns a house next to their traditional Mongolian ger, they don't live in their house because the house has deteriorated over the years. The interior walls and windows have became so fragile they do not protect the family from incoming storms and frosts. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,700,000 MNT in order to purchase building and insulation materials such as fiberglass, cotton, foam, bricks, cement and planks. Using these materials, she can make an extension to her house and insulate the interior walls and windows. As a result, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and contribute to the efforts against air pollution. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una señora  de 29 años,  es madre soltera y  vive en Sololá. Ella tiene dos hijos un varón de 10 años y una nena de 8 años, ellos están estudiando. 
Ella se dedica a la venta  de frutas preparadas,  que son colocadas en bandejas y de esta forma sale a ofrecer  en las oficinas, tiendas, juzgados etc. Ella empezó este pequeño negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos a raíz de la  separación con su pareja. Ella lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos y de esta manera salir adelante también como mujer.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para capital de trabajo y así ampliar su negocio de frutas, mejorando su  ingreso y  el servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es construir una casa propia para ella y sus hijos ya que por el momento están alquilando  la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Ana is a 29-year old woman.  She is a single mother and lives in Sololá.  She has two children, a 10-year old son and a little girl who is 8 years old.  They both go to school.
Ana makes her living selling prepared fruit.  She puts the fruit in trays and offers it for sale at offices, stores, the courts etc.  She started this small business out of a need to support her children after she separated from her partner.  She works hard to ensure her children's well-being and to get ahead as a woman. 
Ana is requesting a loan of Q 3,000.00 (USD $400) for working capital to expand her fruit-selling business.  She wants to improve her income and the service she offers to her customers. 
Ana's dream is to build her own home, for herself and her children.  For now, they live in a rented house.

loans.use: with working capital to expand her fruit-selling business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is from Samraong Tong district, Kompong Speu province of Cambodia. She lives together with her spouse and two unmarried children.  The rest of her children have settled down and started their own families. Hang and her spouse are in the same business.  They cultivate a few plots of farmland in order to make their livelihoods. Instead of being free at home, Hang has also tried to involve herself selling Khmer cakes for additional profit. In the same manner, Hang’s husband devotes his spare time to trading potatoes and palm juice as a wholesale business. The difficulty he has experienced in his business is that he does not have a motorcycle to appropriately transport his products. 

To compete against the challenge, Hang would like to acquire a loan amounting to USD 1,000 in order to purchase a motorcycle to support the current business of her husband. She believes that the loan will have a positive impact toward the achievement of their goals and allow them to move their family forward.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support the current business of her husband.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Cheam is a 40-year-old woman who is married and has five children. Together they live in a small village of Prey Chor district, where she began farming as her primary source of income. Having been doing this occupation for years, Cheam is very confident of handling and managing her business with great support from her husband and children. She normally generates at least KHR 5,000 per day and she intends to make it more viable and profitable as she tries hard to expand her business in the years to come.

Cheam has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 in order to cover the cost of land which she will rent to grow rice. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and thereby increase her main income. In the future, Cheam will attempt to escape from poverty and to secure the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land which she will rent to grow rice.

loans.name: Rita Frances

texts.en: Rita is a widowed woman from Cabagan with two children. She is engaged in making and selling frozen foods. She wants to expand her business, however she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, and hamburger patties for her business. With this, she will be able to make and sell more frozen foods.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods like hot dogs, tocino, and hamburger patties for her business.

loans.name: Pheary's Group

texts.en:
Pheary, 39, is a rural villager from Pursat Province. She has three children under her care as they are still in school. Rice farming on two hectares of farmland and pig raising are the main sources of income for her family. She has been with this business for 30 years and is able to earn up to 21,000 riels. 

Pheary has taken out loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) four times including this cycle. She has completely paid back her past loan, which has better supported her living as well as her business – especially her pig-raising business. In need of working capital, she formed a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income in order to maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash for farmland

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
Sarou, 48, lives in a rural village of the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. To earn a living, she has been farming rice for ten years. To complement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day, but she can manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sarou is a fifth-cycle client with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo is 50 years of age, married and a business-oriented person. He offers rice, eggs, cooking ingredients and fish sauce at the public market. He is thankful because he is able to dispose of his rice immediately. With the smooth flow of his business, he plans to increase the number of sacks of rice he offers but he doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000.He will be using this loan in buying additional bags of rice to be sold. He hopes that he could expand his rice retailing business, enabling him to earn greater income and improve his way of living. Wilfredo believes that his hard work and perseverance will enable him to fulfill his dream in life.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret, 48, lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers, and she has been in this business for 28 years. She is able to earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Saret has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past two loans, which she has repaid, have helped her relieve the financial burden and improve her livelihood. 

The group is now requesting a new loan.  Saret, the group leader, will use her portion to buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent motor to use.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting in her family

loans.name: Savoet's Group

texts.en: Savoet, 33, is married with two dependent children who are both still in school. Her family lives in a house with thatched roof located in Battambang province’s Sangke district, and the main source of her family’s income is working for others for a fee. She and her husband has been with this job for ten years, earning about KHR 26,000 per day; she is able to save about KHR 10,000 each day. Savoert received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business, and support her family’s needs.  Now, she wants to start another small scale business, rice trading. Therefore, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan.As the the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy 15 sacks of rice to stock for resale when the price is high. She hopes this business will double her income so that she can upgrade her lifestyle better than before .

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice to stock for resale

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 51 years old and is engaged in selling fish as a source of income. She has been doing this for almost eleven years and earns 5,000 PHP every month, which is not enough to cover her growing necessities. Mildred is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more fish to resell. She hopes this will help to increase her income. After all, she is doing her best to provide a better income and standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Chaylem's Group

texts.en: Chaylem, 32, lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moungkol Borey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, she and her husband earn a living as teachers in the local area. They have been in this job for several years.This is Chaylem’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Her group has only three members, all of whom have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. She and her members completely paid back the past loans from VisionFund, and Chaylem has used the loans to improve her family’s standard of living in a gradual manner. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Chaylem is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to fix her house on time so she does not need to worry about unpredictable weather issue, including too dry or rain.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en: Saveth is 42 years old and the married mother of five children. Her family lives in Pursat Province. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice and raises pigs as the main source of income. This 20 years of experience in this business generates about 18,700 KHR per day to support her standard of living. She is the group leader in the group of three. Saveth is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), while one of her co-borrowers is a six cycle client and another one is a third cycle client. Now, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR.  Saveth, whose loan portion is 200,000 KHR, will use her loan to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice. She hopes that growing more rice in her business will allow her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.name: Keb

texts.en:
Keb is a resident of Prey Chor district, which is a central district of Kompong Cham surrounded by other Kompong Cham districts. Local people of the region rely on agribusiness and commercial trade. As other villagers, Keb, aged 38, owns and manages a farming business as a major source of her income. To help contribute to the development of their living standard, Keb’s husband works to provide cooking services especially for parties and religious ceremonies around the province.

Keb would like to make some home improvements and is taking out a loan in the amount of USD 1,000 in order to build kitchen shelves and to connect the household to electricity. She believes that her family will be satisfied and live more comfortably with the loan outcome. Her dream is to keep growing her business and educate her four children.

loans.use: to build kitchen shelves and to connect the household to electricity.

loans.name: Samul

texts.en:
Samul, a rural villager from Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, is 29 years old and is married. She has two children who solely rely on her as they are still in school.  

To feed her family, Samul grows rice and sells vegetables. This is her family's primary source of income. Her husband works as a paid worker for extra income. Samul has been in this business for 10 years. 

Samul has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is applying for her first loan in order to buy a plot of farmland to expand her business. She hopes to increase her income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland on which to grow rice and vegetables.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Peach's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old mother of three kids residing in Battambang province, Peach is married and is one of the villagers who grow rice as their primary source of income. To help her in earning more income, her husband also has another job as the cooking chef during wedding ceremonies. This 10 years' engagement in her current business has provided Peach with about 26,700 KHR as her daily income. 

Peach is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, her living standard is better than before which is owing to a positive outcome of her past loans; she also fully repaid her past loans with success. 

Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She is the group leader and will use her loan portion to pay plowing fees. She really hopes that she can earn more income and upgrade her living standard constantly.

loans.use: To pay plowing fee

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Residing in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Touch is 45 and married. She has four children, two of whom still dependent on her since they are students at the local state school.  

To support this huge family, she been farming on a half hectare area, which she has been doing for 21 years. To better feed the family, her husband also uses his spare time to work for others for a fee.  

Touch has been a member of Kiva’s partner for three cycles, and she has used her past loans successfully to better support her family and keep her children in school.   

Now she is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); Touch will use it to build a new concrete kitchen. She hopes this loan will enable her to build her kitchen on time so she can have a hygenic place to cook clean food for her children and have better health in the family.

loans.use: To build a new concrete kitchen.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn, a rural villager residing in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, is married and blessed with three children. All of them are still under her dependency, since two are school children while a remaining one is an invalid. The main incomes are solely from Sivorn's occupation as a garment factory worker and her husband’s job as a construction worker. The current main challenge for Sivorn's family is the low condition of her house. 

To overcome this challenge, she has reapplied for a new loan with VisionFund Cambodia. Sivorn has been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles. She has managed her past loan properly, to upgrade her lifestyle. 

For this new cycle, Sivorn will use her loan portion to fix her house. She hopes the loan will help her to renovate her house on time, so she does not need to worry about her house condition during either the upcoming dry season or rainy season.

loans.use: to fix her house.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Originally from a rural village in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Sokun is a 45-year-old married mother of four children. Two of her four children are still financially dependent as they are students in the local state school. Rice farming has been the main source of income for her family for seven years. To supplement the family’s income, her husband works for others for a fee. Sokun has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles. She successfully used past loans to better support her entire family, especially to cover her children’s education. Now she is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to grow her healthy rice to earn more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is 49 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in Ponhea Krek district of Kompong Cham province. She has three children, including one son who still counts on her as her son and is still in school. 

To strive for a living, Soeurn does rice cropping on three hectares of farmland and works for others for extra income. This 27-year engagement in the current business has returned her approximately 19,900 KHR per day, of which 13,500 KHR is her saving portion after deducting expenses. 

This is Soeurn’s fourth cycle loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has managed her past loan wisely to improve her livelihood and keep her children in school. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her cash-crop. Soeurn hopes this purchase will boost her output on a larger scale and sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cash-crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ma. Rachel

texts.en:
Ma. Rachel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Rachel has been in this business for one year. Ma. Rachel earns additional income from raising livestock.

Ma. Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, vinegar, snack foods, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is a citizen from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, where rice farming is the common business among her neighborhood. She is 50 years old, and is a married mother blessed with seven children. Of her seven children, only two sons are still under her dependency, with one being in school and the other is under-aged for schooling. 

Just like her neighbors, Ry cultivates rice as well as growing potatoes. Her husband is the main human power helping her on the field. This couple also uses their spare time to earn extra income, through working for others for a fee, for the sake of their children. The current business, which she has been in for 26 years, returns her about 30,900 KHR per day and, of which she saves about 22,900 KHR per day.

This is Ry's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for her first loan in the amount of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy potash and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can get a high yield from both her cash-crops, and earn more income so that she can set aside more money to buy a mini tractor to support her business.

loans.use: to buy potash and to pay for labor costs for her rice and potato growing business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio’s business provides for his family’s daily expenditures. For eight years, he has been in the business of selling wood and he wishes to increase his usual profit. He would be able to do this if he had stable funds to use. To make it possible, he is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 in order to buy more wood to sell. He hopes that his wish to increase his sales will soon be achieved.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 37 years old and married with four children.

Rosana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase additional sacks of rice and goods to sell in her store.

Rosana has borrowed and paid two previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear, raising livestock and retailing rice.

Rosana aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresa. She operates a used clothing store and previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of used clothes and other products to expand her inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the personal, household, and business expenditures of her family.

Ma. Teresa is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes and other products. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. Ma. Teresa looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Teresa dreams that her business will grow and she hopes to have a good life. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to stock of used but quality clothes and other products

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Sam is aged 48 and is married with five children. They live in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice on one hectare while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income. 

Sam is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sam has just joined Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. Sam, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Tean's Group

texts.en:
Tean, 51, is a local inhabitant from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She has six children only one of whom still counts on her as he is still in school. She and her husband have only one primary source of income, rice farming. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for ages. 

Tean has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Her previous loan has helped her to upgrade her living gradually; she also finally can manage to repay her loan successfully as well. 

For this cycle, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her fellow group member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her kitchen. She hopes to own a proper kitchen for her family so that she can provide decent and clean food for her kid.

loans.use: To renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Arnielyn

texts.en: Arnelyn is married and has two children. She is 28 years-old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She cultivates mangoes and plants vegetables (particularly eggplant) in order to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns about PHp8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHp10,000 in order to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She's been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Arnelyn hopes to improve her business so that she can have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Renan

texts.en:
Renan is a 37-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  He is still single and he works hard to provide income for his everyday needs.  He is also financially assisting his parents and siblings.  Renan operates a junk shop.  

Since trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags while waiting for their local dump trucks.  They scavenge for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials.  They sell these to junk shops like Joey’s for a little profit.  Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries such as factories.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, he is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan.  He will be incorporating the loan with his current revolving fund, which is used to buy trash from collectors.  He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Renan hopes that his business will continue to grow and he dreams that his family will have a good life.  He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif runs a small stall known as Daffa Cell where he sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments for his customers. He is an entrepreneur and has three people living in his house including his six-year-old son. He joined Ruma a year ago because he wanted to expand to other business opportunities by selling mobile phone airtime credit. For the last three months, he has around $30 - $70 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Dwi

texts.en:
Dwi runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits, and also services bill payments for customers. She is an entrepreneur, while her husband works as a salesman. She has three people living in her house, including her 2-year-old daughter. 

Dwi joined Ruma eight months ago because she wanted to expand into other business opportunities through selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Dwi has had around $30-$50/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs well, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en: Em, an elderly father of nine children, is 58 years old and a local farmer who grows rice as the primary source of income. He can make additional through leasing a speaker as a paid-service. This 34-year-old business brings him about 19,500 KHR per day. Em, a fifth time borrower, forms a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid back his past loan which has better supported his business and helped it to make good progress. Now, he is seeking for a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike to support his living as well as his business. He hopes this motorbike will relieve his burden related to transportation expenses so he can set aside some money for his future needs and for the sake of his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support his living as well as his business.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur and has three people living in his house, including his only son (as you can see in the picture). 

Agus joined Ruma more than two years ago because he wants to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for customers. 

For the last three months, Agus has had around $121/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Alita has been in this business for one year. Alita earns additional income from a general store.

Alita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Fe is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell for her general store

loans.name: Chairul

texts.en:
Chairul is a student who sells mobile phone airtime credits. He still lives in his parents’ house with three people living in the house. He joined Ruma five and a half months ago because he got interested in having additional income and feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for the customers. 

For the last three months, he has around $70 - $100 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Dianning

texts.en:
Dianning runs small permanent stall which sells snacks, drinks, children's toys, mobile phone airtime credits, and also serves bill payment for the customers. She is an entrepreneur and has four people living in her house, including her wonderful teenager twin daughters. She joined Ruma 10 months ago because she wanted to increase her income and feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments for the customers. 

For the last 3 months, Dianning has around $70 - $80 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business keeps running, she needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Noldi

texts.en:
Noldi is a 23-year-old single woman who is living with her parents. After she graduated from high school, she decided to start a kiosk business. Noldi is responsible for taking care of her parents. Moreover, her father has retired. 
Lately, Noldi was thinking of adding stocks of items such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, and cooking oil to her kiosk. She needs capital assistance to do so. 
Noldi met a loan officer and got some information on TLM's lending program. She was interested in the individual lending program. She then requested a loan of 4,500,000 IDR. Noldi is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to buy stocks of items such as cigarettes, instant noodles, snacks, and cooking oil for her kiosk.

loans.name: Imas

texts.en: Imas runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits. She is an entrepreneur and has three people living in her house including her only two-year-old daughter. She joined Ruma 11 months ago because she wanted to have additional income and feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone air time credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, she has around $20 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she needs more working capital to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on the weekend

loans.name: Norng

texts.en:
Aged 58 years, Norng is a single woman living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer for 30 years. Norng is able to earn about 30,000 KHR per day but she can save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 
This is the sixth loan for Norng with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan of 3,000,000 KHR with VisionFund and she is going to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice successfuly so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mahpudin

texts.en: Mahpudin runs a small stall, which sells snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepeneur and has three persons living in his house. He joined Ruma four months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He still feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $70 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
Consolita is 63 years-old and married with four children.

Consolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Consolita has borrowed and repaid 29 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from a general store and selling brooms.

Consolita aspires to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en:
Rainer is married and has two children. He is 37 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Rainer owns and manages a sari-sari store to earn a living. He has had this business for 15 years. Each month he earns PHP 9,000 doing this work.

He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase new items to sell, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and canned goods. Rainer has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. Rainer hopes to expand his sari-sari store in the future, to sustain his family's daily needs and for the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps and canned goods

loans.name: Jereil

texts.en: Jereil lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been making her living by providing transportation services for three years, to support her child. For this 28-year old mother, nothing would make her more happy than seeing her child successful at school. Jeriel gets an income of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month from her business. She joined GDMPC this year and has borrowed 15,000 PHP to repair the vehicle used in her business. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila runs a sari-sari (variety) store in her place in Getafe, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 15 years. Her husband works as a carpenter.
 
Cirila is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to resell in her store, like canned goods, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items. With these purchases, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

Cirila has hopes of making her business a success, and sustainable into the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children, and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to resell, like canned goods, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more materials used for his motorcycle repair business (motor parts, tools)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos is a 34 year old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has one son. Carlos is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business, the farm and the harvest. In the future, Carlos hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds, vaccines and supplements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials for making tombstones (lapida) to sell.

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Ulzii, 36 years old, has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Before providing the taxi service, he was driving a bus for three years at a private transportation entity. He is divorced and his only son now lives with his wife separately from him. Using his previous loan, he repaired his automobile which he uses for the taxi service and paid each installment debt on schedule without delay. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a television and a bed. Purchasing these items will certainly improve his living standard. In particular, a comfortable bed will enable him to sleep well. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his son and contributes to his son's education by remitting money.

loans.use: to purchase a television and bed

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 29 years old and married with one daughter. To support her family, she and her husband have been buying and selling garbage for three years and sometime they work as paid workers in the local area to earn extra income. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Navy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely repaid the past loans which have helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for another loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Navy wants to use her portion to buy garbage to resell. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy garbage to resell

loans.name: Sinforiano

texts.en:
Sinforiano is a 60-year-old married man with six children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sinforiano has a business buying and selling seaweed in the Philippines. Sinforiano requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more seaweed to sell.

Sinforiano has been in this business for nine years. Sinforiano would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 55 años de edad, esta casada con Pedro con quien tiene 7 hijos todos mayores e independientes. Ahora solo vive con su esposo en la casa que compraron hace 40 años.  
Desde joven aprendió a trabajar en la tierra, comenta que a temprana edad formó su familia, por lo que tuvo que comenzar a trabajar en la siembra de papa, maíz, habas y demás alimentos propios de la zona. Los terrenos agrícolas de extensas áreas que posee los adquirió de la herencia de sus padres. Es así que en cada cosecha, comercializa sus alimentos en el mercado de su localidad ya que son conocidos por la producción de maíz orgánico . Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos, pues su principal dificultad es el idioma, ya que habla Quechua y eso le dificulta negociar sus cosechas. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio ,por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Faustina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Faustina, 55, is married to Pedro with whom she has seven children, all of whom are independent adults. She presently lives with just her husband in the home that they bought 40 years ago.

Since she was young, she learned to work in the field. She says that at an early age she started her family, so she had to begin working in the harvest of potato, corn, beans, and the other plants typical of the area. She inherited the extensive area of agricultural land that she possesses from her parents. It is in this way that in each harvest she sells her produce in the market of her locality, since she is known for growing organic corn. Now she wants to improve her income, as her main difficulty in negotiating her harvests is language since she speaks Quechua. This is her first loan with Kiva; she is grateful for the opportunity that they're offering her since she will be able to improve her business. For this reason, she promises to be timely with her installment payments. Faustina will invest the money in purchasing organic fertilizer to enrich her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Herminda Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Herminda continúa con su negocio de pulpería apoyada por su pareja e hijos quienes la apoyan en todo y juntos salen adelante, sus créditos con Afodenic y Kiva lo ha utilizado invirtiéndole a su negocio, lo que le ha permitido mejorar su economía por lo que está muy agradecida, en esta ocasión desea invertir nuevamente en productos como granos básicos, enlatados, lácteos, gaseosas y productos nuevos para ofrecerle variedad a su clientela.
texts.en: Herminda continues to run her grocery store business, supported by her partner and children who help her with everything and together they get ahead. She has used her loans from AFODENIC and Kiva to invest in her business, which has allowed her to improve her finances for which she is very grateful. On this occasion, she wants to once again invest in products such as bulk grains, canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, and new products in order to offer variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, canned goods, dairy products, soft drinks, and new products.

loans.name: Soey's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in Battambang province’s Sangke district, Soey is 49 and married with two children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For more than ten years, she has been selling snacks while her husband is a motor taxi driver to help his family. 

Soey has been a member of VisionFund for five cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to make her living conditions better. Now, she is leading her group to request another loan. As the leader, Soey will use her portion to buy potatoes and beans to make snacks. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and beans to make snacks.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Originally from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province, Oun is a local farmer who solely depends on planting two types of crops, rice and cassava. She can earn more income through working for others for a fee. This is the business that she has been doing for 15 years and she is able to earn up to 41,000 KHR per day. A third-time borrower, Oun is in a group of two composing of two female members to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After her last successful loan, she feels confident that she can upgrade her lifestyle gradually better than before. Now, she wants to expand her agriculture business and boost her crop production through potash purchasing. Therefore, she is seeking 1,400,000 KHR for this cycle to serve the above purpose while her joint member is seeking 1,100,000 KHR. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to enlargen her cash-crop growing farmland and return her a good yield with high profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахору 46 лет. Она добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее старшая дочь замужем и имеет ребенка. Итак, Гулбахор хорошая бабушка. Муж Гулбахора плотник и его зарплата не хватает для улучшения условия проживания, так как они живут бедно. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота, так как ее дом большой и имеет огород, где можно выращивать сено для скота. Ее дети будут помогать ей введение бизнеса. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат, что она может организовать бизнес и успешно управлять им. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей организовать бизнес и найти источника дохода, которому очень нуждается ее семья.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is 46 years old.  She is a kind woman with a zest for life.  She is married and raising three children.  Her oldest daughter is married and has a child.  Gulbahor is a good grandmother.

Gulbahor's husband is a carpenter. His salary is not enough to improve the family's living conditions, which is why they are living in poverty.  

Gulbahor wants to start her own business, buying and selling livestock.  They have a big house with a vegetable garden where she could grow hay for the livestock.  Her children intend to help her with the business.

Gulbahor has completed a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she has received a certificate which makes it possible for her to start and successfully manage a new business.

She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy some livestock, and is awaiting your kindness.  This loan will help her to start her business and to find a much needed source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start her new business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina, 54, is married with 2 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She raises pigs for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined in GDMPC since the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pig-raising business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pig-raising business.

loans.name: Palomitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PALOMITAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nemesia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de batidos, venta de ropa de adulto, venta de ropa interior y joyas, ambulante, venta de helado, venta de medicina natural, venta de cosméticos, venta de sombreros y gorras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nemesia es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermano que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace mas de diez años por recomendación de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
The community bank "Palomitas Blancas" will start its thirteenth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Focus Center of the Andes. It is comprised of nine members and directed by a board of directors, of which Nemesia is President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank bring forward are various; among them are: milkshake sales, adult clothing sales, under garment and jewelry sales, ice cream sales, natural medicine sales, cosmetics sales, and hat sales. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses where Nemesia is a member. She said that nine years ago she joined Pro Mujer, by the invitation of her sister, who is an associate of the institution. Currently she has a business selling clothes. She says that she learned this business more than ten years ago by her mother's recommendation. 

The loan that she will take out now is for the increase of capital (purchase of clothing), that she will acquire from wholesale vendors, and later she will sell it at her stand. This form of working allows her to generate resources to maintain her home, as she lives with someone and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the area of health and the trainings about loans.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.ru: Маниже 38 лет. Она замужем за милиционера и имеет 3 детей. Она родилась и выросла в столице. После окончания Таджикского Национального Университета она поступила на работу бухгалтером в транспортной организации. Манижа и ее муж стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование и успешно строили карьеру. Старший сын Мнижи, Алишер учится в Китае. Он студент 1 курса. Манижа должна оплатить за учебу сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Manizha is 38 years old.  She is married to a police officer and has three children.  She was born and grew up in Dushanbe.  After graduating from the Tajik National University, she started to work as an accountant for a transportation company.

Manizha and her husband do everything they can so that their children receive a higher education and then successfully build their careers.  Manizha's eldest son, Alisher, is currently studying in China where he is a first-year student.  Manizha needs to pay his tuition costs, but she does not have enough money to do so.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars to pay her son's tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition.

loans.name: Victorino Asuncion

texts.es: Victorino Asunción de 61 años de edad casado con 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 12 años de edad todos estudian, originarios del municipio de Chinandega, el cual está ubicado en el occidente del país y se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva en el comercio,  Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general desde hace más de 14 años, en el que consiste en la compra de venta de sandalias, ropa de adultos, cosméticos, chinerías, adornos, productos plásticos, retrateras, relojes grandes, espejos pequeños entre otros, El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería como: comprara pantalones, calzado, cosméticos, sabanas y toallas entre otros y así  mejorar la calidad de sus productos que ofrece a su clientela, y  de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de comercializarlos, Victorino  es una persona luchadora que a pesar de su edad el da el todo por el todo por su familia, él está muy agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo que ellos les brindan a las personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Victorino Asunción, 61, is married and has 3 children aged 13, 10 and 12 who are in school.  They are natives of the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country and is known for being a very productive commercial area.

For more than 14 years, Victorino has been selling general merchandise such as sandals, adult clothing, cosmetics, trinkets, decorative items, plastic products, picture frames, big watches, small mirrors, and other items.  He will use this loan to invest in working capital and to stock up his general merchandise business by purchasing pants, shoes, cosmetics, bed sheets, towels, and other items.  This way, he can improve the quality of the products that he offers his customers and thereby obtain more income when he sells the products.  

Victorino is a tenacious person who, in spite of his age, gives his utmost for his family.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support that they are providing to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, plastic items, clothing for adults, cosmetics, trinkets, and other products

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуне 21 года. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж врач и очень хорошо относится своей семье. Мавзуна получила среднее специальное образование парикмахера. Она более чем 1 года работает парикмахером. Она имеет свой парикмахерский мини салон, где преподносит услуги парикмахера, как стрижка волос, укладка волос, покраска волос, разные прически, макияж. Она имеет своих клиентов и благодаря хорошему сервису ее клиенты не однократно посещают ее салон. Она хочет развивать бизнес дальше и получить больше дохода. Она для развития своего бизнеса должна купить новые приборы, как фен, набор расчесок, а также различные краски. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки необходимых приборов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is 21 years old.  She is married, with no children.  Her husband is a physician who gets along very well with her own family.

Mavzuna graduated from a vocational high school, specializing in hairdressing.  She has now been working as a hairdresser for more than a year.  She owns a mini-salon, where she offers services such as hair cutting, hair styling and hair dyeing.  She can do many hairdos and also does make-up.  She has her own clientele, and thanks to the quality of her work, her customers visit her salon more than once.

Mavzuna wants to further develop her business and to make a larger income.  In order to develop her business, she needs to buy some new equipment: a hair dryer, an assortment of combs and various hair dyes.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy some essential equipment.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Vang is 42 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is employed as a garment worker. Vang lives together with his spouse and children in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. Vang and his wife work together in an agricultural business, growing rice on a few pieces of farmland they inherited from their parents. They have been doing this type of business for more than 20 years.

Vang has borrowed two times in the past from HKL, to solve his financial problems and sustain his business. And now, he has come to the HKL office again, to take out another loan that he will use to buy construction materials. He will use them to build a house for his eldest child, who is already engaged to be married soon. In the future, Vang would like to save enough money to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a house for his eldest child.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Kang is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He currently lives with his spouse and children in Kompong Speu province. Kang’s focused business activities are growing and harvesting rice to sell to local traders. He has been doing this business for over 20 years and earns a decent income, which goes for meals and school allowances for his children. For additional income, Kang harvests a kind of water lily plant, with a long, edible stalk, to sell in a market of his area. He would like to keep making his businesses profitable and have a sustainable income, for the overall welfare of his family.

With this loan, he is buying floorboards to fill in the blank space of his house, as it is now under construction. It will be a very comfortable place for members of his family. He is pleased to have this loan, which enables him to develop his living standard.

loans.use: to buy floorboards to fill in the blank space of his house, as it is now under construction.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim is a local farmer from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She lives in a thatched-roof house, with her family, including five children. Out of her five children, she needs to support only three. Two of the dependent children are still in school, while the remaining one is still too young for schooling. Lim does her rice cropping business on a two-hectare area, which she has been working for 13 years. This work earns her about 23,600 KHR per day.

This is the third microloan for Lim and her co-borrower in the same group of two, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she can move her family’s living status toward an upward trend, better than before. Now, her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR, whereas her fellow group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Lim will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing her land. She highly expects that she can gain double yield compared to before, and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing her land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pek's Group

texts.en: Pek, 41, is a mother of six children living in Pursat Province’s Kror Kor district.  Two of her children are still in school. She weaves palm tree leaves, the material which the rural people use to cover their house as a roof, as her primary source of income. To better feed her family, her husband works as a home builder. Her current business earns her about 9,900 KHR per day. Pek has never been a client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to renovate her home. She hopes that his loan will allow her to provide a decent home for her kids.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun is 35 years old and  lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district in Battambang province. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have struggled but managed to feed and care for their children by farming rice and planting corn. Together, they can earn about 40,000 KHR per day.
Soun has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the previous loans. Soun wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve the family’s financial burden. Now she is asking for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow her rice and corn healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her cultivated land.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 32 years old and married with a child who is attending school. He dedicates himself to farming, working around 8 hours a day during harvest season. He has been farming for almost 8 years on his own farm where he mainly grows rice for consumption. San also takes time to work in the construction industry to supplement his wages.

This loan that he needs will permit him to buy a motorcycle for personal use, buy a cow, and for the maintenance of the rice field. He says this loan would allow him and his family members better transportation and help increase his rice output. Having many years of experience, San dreams to have enough building tools and laborers to begin a construction project for himself. He believes that he can provide a better quality of life for his family by strengthening the business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal purpose, buy a cow, and for the maintenance of the rice field.

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Poch is a 49-year-old mother of eleven children, five of whom are still dependent on her and still in school. To support her big family, she has been struggling to feed her children by farming rice for 31 years. To supplement her income, her husband is a labourer. 
This is the sixth loan for Poch with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on renovating her old home. She hopes to earn a high crop yield from her rice paddy and also hopes to have a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas is 47 years old and is an industrious mother of three children. She lives with her husband and two children in Samraong Tong district of Kompong Speu province. Meas began farming to help the family earn more income. Despite her hardships at the rice paddy, Meas wishes to provide and maintain her healthy family by being a responsible housewife and farmer.

This is the first loan she received from HKL and she has never had other loans with state banks. She is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle for her home use and will use it for transporting her children around so they don't have to pay transport fees. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to save more for the future of her family and business. She hopes that someday, her business will grow and become a good source of income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for personal use

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбубе 34 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Она живет с родителями и старается помочь своим родителям. Махбуба несколько раз старалась организовать свой бизнес, но у неё не получалась. Она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила много новой информации о бизнесе. Она получила сертификат. Махбуба хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, так как она живет в сельской местности и имеет хорошею условию для скотоводства. Она будет покупать скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке по более высокой цене. Она будет справляться с бизнесом сама. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba is 34 years old. She is divorced and does not have children. She lives with her parents and tries to help them. Mahbuba has tried to start her own business several times, but did not succeed. She has found out about the Achieve Success course organized by the Association of Business Women and received a lot of information about business. She has received a certificate. Mahbuba wants to start a business selling cattle because she lives in the rural area and has good conditions for animal husbandry. She will buy cattle, keep it for several months and then resell on the local market at a higher price. She will run the business herself. Mahbuba is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Mohniso

texts.ru: Мохнисо 27 лет. Она за мужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж солдат и находится в армии. Он будет служить 2 года. Итак, Мохнисо должна обеспечить себя сама. Она не имеет высшее образование и поэтому не может работать на престижных и высокооплачиваемых местах. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых женщин и получила сертификат, что она умеет организовать бизнес и развевать его. Она планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей скота, то есть купле продажей барана. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mohniso is 27 years old. She is married, but does not have children. Her husband is a soldier and is in the army now. He will serve for two years. So Mohniso has to support herself. She does not have a higher education and that's why cannot work on prestigious and high paying jobs. She wants to start her own business and become successful in this field. Mohniso has taken an Achieve Success cource organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate showing that she can start and grow a business. She plans to organize a business selling cattle, particularly selling sheep. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Rosamery

texts.es:
Rosamery tiene 29 años de edad, está casada con Willington de 30 años y tiene un niño de 5 años , juntos viven en una casa construida a base de adobe .Rosamery se dedica a la producción de cacao orgánico .Ganó experiencia desde niña, puesto que brindo apoyo en labores menores a sus padres por ser la principal fuente de ingreso que tenia su familia en aquel entonces ,con el paso de los años logro obtener un pequeño terreno agrícola el cual fue cedido por sus padres para el sustento de su propia familia. En está actividad se debe de brindar los cuidados necesarios a las plantaciones de cacao para así extraer buenas mazorcas las cuales seran vendidas en el mercado de su localidad pero para realizar este trabajo necesita contratar trabajadores del lugar quienes conocen mucho más de este negocio.
