Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, se muestra muy agradecida y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Requiere contar con S/.2,000 soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar y proceder con la cosecha respectiva.
texts.en:
Rosamery is 29 years old. She is married to Willington, 30 and has a 5-year-old son. They all live together in a brick house. Rosamery grows organic cocoa, something she learned when she was a small girl while helping her parents with minor tasks. This activity was by then the family’s main source of income.

With time, Rosamery received a small piece of land from her parents, for supporting her family. This activity requires commitment to the cocoa plants, in order to obtain good pods and sell them in the local marketplace. For this, she needs to hire local workers who know much more about this business.

This is Rosamery’s first loan with Kiva. She is grateful and promises to pay the installments on time. The 2,000 soles [PEN] she is requesting will be used to hire local workers and start with the collection of the cocoa fruits.

loans.use: to hire local workers for her cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 32 years old and has one child.  Cerelina is a widow and has one child who is in school.

Cerelina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Cerelina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock for her livestock business.  Cerelina has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cerelina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 41 years old, lives with her husband and children in Kherlen, eastern town of Mongolia.  She has been working as a cook at a  restaurant since 2011.  

Her family resides in their own house on a plot of land.  The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repairs.  During the winter time, the family chills down to their core so they decided to make an extension to the house in order to reduce heat loss.  In order to make the extension, she needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, bricks and cement.  As a result, the family will burn less coal thus contributing to the effort to reduce air pollution.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Yem is a 51-year-old mother of six children and earns a living through farming rice in the local area.  Out of her six children, she still has two children to take care of and they are still in school.  Yem and her husband have been in her business for nineteen years and the current business earns them about 60,000 KHR per day to feed the family.

Yem has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other members have been for five cycles.  Yem wisely and successfully used her past loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living and business needs.  Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan.  As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.  She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng is a 63-year-old inhabitant residing in Kompong Speu province. She is involved in land cultivation, working hard to gather a plentiful harvest on one and half hectare of farmland. She has been working in the agricultural sector for more than 30 years and it has been the main source of her family’s income so far. Teng would like to expand her agriculture activity, and thus boost her production in years to come. Due to inadequate capital, Teng has applied for a loan to purchase a cow to help work more efficiently and minimize the operating costs. The loan is very important for Teng to be able to cultivate more rice, which will significantly increase her income. In the future, Teng hopes to have a better quality of life and secure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to help work her fields more efficiently and minimize the operating costs.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Savy is now 44 years old and married. She has six children, three who are dependents and are still in school. Savy and her husband are farmers and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for four years, they are able to make 30,000KHR daily and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day.
This is the eighth loan for Savy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it on water pumping. She hopes this loan will boost her rice plantation and also grow healthy crops to make more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for water pumping.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old, married and has one child who is in school. Elvira is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock such as cattle, chickens, pigs, etc.
Elvira has been buying and selling livestock for 11 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock such as cattle, chickens, and pigs.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son has turned 22 and is the loving father of a child.  He and his wife work together on their own farm in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia.  Together, they can earn a decent income to cover home expenses.  Son has been involved in farming for about five years.  In their eagerness to lift the family out of poverty, Son works full time at the construction site after harvest season while his wife has a position in a local garment factory.

Son is now requesting his first cycle loan because he needs to continue investing in the planting and cultivation of rice.  The loan will allow him to purchase a farm animal and to prepare the land.  He’s sure everything’s going to be better and he might have a fruitful crop yield from the planting.

loans.use: to purchase a farm animal and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Soknang

texts.en: Soknang, a young mother of two little kids, is a farmer originally from the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. She does rice cropping on two hectares of farmland as her main income source and raises pigs as supplementary income. In her three year engagement in the current business, she has been able to earn about 12,300 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Soknang with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. With this loan she will buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy-season crops. She hopes to gain more yield and make more income for her kid’s sake.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy-season crops.

loans.name: Milikije

texts.en:
Milikije is 42 years old and married with five children. She lives in a village in the southern part of Kosovo. Milikije makes a living by raising cows, and her husband does construction work. She started her business by selling milk in her neighborhood. “I am very pleased with this business because I have reduced my family’s expenses while increasing our income,” said Milikije.

She claims that she works a lot to support her family financially. Her life has been greatly improved and she is requesting a loan to buy another cow. This is Milikije's first loan. In the future she wants to expand her business and save for her childrens university expenses. She is aware that without Kiva lenders, her goal will be difficult to achieve. Milikije is very appreciative for the help.

loans.use: to buy another cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen is 52 years old and originally from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is married with five children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband grow rice as the main source of the family’s income. They also supplement their income by working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for twenty-five years, they earn about 43,000 KHR per day and provide for the family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.
Chen has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase crop yields to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en: A married mother of five children, Van is a local resident of Battambang province and earns a living through rice cropping on two hectares of land. Besides helping her on the farmland, her husband also works for others for a fee. She is able to earn up to 40,000 KHR per day from the rice cropping, which she has been doing for 25 years. This is the third microloan for Van’s group, consisting of three female members including her. She has repaid back her past loans with success which were used to increase yield for her rice and increase her income. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops. She hopes that she can earn more money for her kids’ sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old and married with four children.She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like coffee, cooking oil, powdered soap, bread, etc. in her general store.

Emelia has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like coffee, cooking oil, powdered soap, bread, etc. in her general store.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is aged 26 years and married with two children. Her family lives in a rural area in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has been raising pigs while her husband is a taxi driver to earn additional income. Having been in this business for ten years, Chan and her husband can earn about 90,000 KHR per day, and they can manage to save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Chan has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other member is just with VisionFund in this cycle. Now Chan is leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy more piglets to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
A breadwinner in the family of seven kids, Van is 61 years old and a widow. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows sugarcane and sells sweets. This is the business that she has been with for six years. Van, an eight time borrower, is in the same group as a four time borrower in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Her living status has upgraded steadily and getting better day by day. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 600,000 KHR. Van, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to pay a plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can earn triple income and support her family better than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah, who is 46 years old, lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is married and raising three children between the ages of 12 and 8 years old. He works in construction. He is the main source of income for the family. His wife is a housewife and spends most of her time taking care of her home. 

Their house is very old, damaged and uncomfortable, and it needs immediate renovation work. Abdullah always wanted to have a comfortable home. His pay is only enough to support their family and they would like to improve their living conditions.

Abdullah is requesting a loan for the first time to repair the windows, doors and roof. With this loan, he will be able to improve their home for the family, and they will be able to live in a more comfortable environment. Abdullah is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping to improve the family's living conditions and their standard of living.

loans.use: To repair the windows, doors and roof.

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Ran, 52, is a local villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She manages a five hectare area for growing cassava, and her husband works for an NGO. With 10 years of experience in the current business, Ran is able to earn about 38,900 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for her group, which consists of two members. Her original loan has better supported her business at a good pace. Now, Ran and her joint borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Ran, as the group leader, will use her loan portion to pay for purchasing potash and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her crops fruitfully and maintain her living status in a good manner.

loans.use: To purchase potash and pesticide and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en:
Chreb is age 32 years and she is a mother of two daughters who are still in school. She and her husband make a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland and from planting cassava on two hectares of farmland, which they have been in for two years. The current business earns them about 46,000 KHR per day.

This is the sixth loan for Chreb with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She repaid the past loans which have helped her to relieve her family’s burden. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR with VisionFund to buy cassava seeds for her cassava business. She will spend a portion of it on plowing the field. Chreb hopes to make more crops and to sell them for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: To buy cassava seeds for her cassava business.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en: Eunice is a twenty-nine year old tailor and the mother of one child. The income she earns from tailoring is limited by low demand and few clients. She wants to join the KOMAZA micro-forestry program "so as to go hand-in-hand with the KOMAZA objective which is to improve the living standard." She aspires to be "a role model lady in society who will be in a position to meet my basic and secondary needs." With the profits from her tree farm, Eunice plans to purchase a new parcel of land as an investment.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Sovanney's Group

texts.en:
Age 38, Sovanney is married with four children living in the Moung Russey district of Battabang province. Currently, she needs to care for only three children as they are still in school. She is able to deal with the daily food consumption by selling Chinese noodle and managing her half hectare of cassava crop. To help her in earning more income, her husband works as a blacksmith. The current business has returned her about 31,900 KHR per day. 

In her group, there are four members, three second-cycle clients and one four-time borrower. She has succeeded in making good use of her loan to sustain her business, the same as her lifestyle. Now, she is a group leader. The total loan amount that her group is requesting is 4,000,000 KHR. Sovanney, whose loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR, will use her loan portion to buy gasoline for pumping water, pesticide, and to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will help her to support her business over time and to get back a good yield.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for pumping water, pesticide, and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Roen is aged 61 years and married. She has four children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in the farming business for eight years. Beside this, they also raise cows to better support her field business. The current business earns her family about 25,700 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Roen’s group consists of two members, and they have been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Roen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn a larger income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 45 years old, has divorced his wife and lives in his sister's apartment. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2005 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. In 2011, he began working as an electrician at a private business entity. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase furniture such as a sofa, table and chair for his sister's home. As he lives in his sister's apartment, he thinks it's his responsibility to improve and support his sister's life. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for his sister.

loans.use: to purchase furniture such as a sofa, table and chairs.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, originally from Battambang province where her residential place is, is married and 45 years old. She has three children who still count on her as they are still students in the local school. To cover the cost of decent daily food, she grows pineapple as her main source of income. This is the business that she has been with for 18 years.

Including this cycle, this is the third loan for Sinat with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has supported her business over time and improved her livelihood. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop production. She hopes to gain a high yield and get more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maku's Group

texts.en:
Maku is a 53-year-old widow and a mother of four grown children. She makes a living in the sale of tomatoes, onions, coconuts and charcoal. However, Maku lacks enough capital to buy large quantities of vegetables to meet her customers' demand. 

She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, "The trees KOMAZA is planting with farmers grow fast and will enable the farmers to get money when they mature".

With the profits from her tree farm, Maku plans to educate her grandchildren and use the coppices (which grow from the stumps of the harvested trees) as building material.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 37, is married with three children.

Flordeliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like coffee, noodles, sugar and other items to sell in her general store.

Flordeliza has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns income from buying and selling gasoline.

Flordeliza aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like coffee, noodles, sugar and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Medza's Group

texts.en:
Medza is a fifty-five-year-old mother of six children and a widow. She sells locally-brewed beer and does casual labor to earn money to support her children. She says she lacks the capital to make large quantities of the brew, and sometimes her supply runs out, so she misses out on potential income. 

Medza says, "I want to plant trees and get money like my other villagers who have joined KOMAZA." She plans to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children, three of whom are still in school, and to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 51 years old and married with twelve children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock. Evangeline is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to purchase a motorcycle in order to have an easy delivery of her charcoal and livestock supplies.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Burim

texts.en:
Burim is a single. He lives with his entire family. He is a very ambitious person and a very hardworker. He is working as an auto mechanic, repairing vehicles. He also has another job in independent transportation. He transports different things depending on the needs of the clients. Mostly, he transports and delivers large household furniture and appliances for people to new homes or during moves.

Burim requested a loan to buy tires for his truck and new tools for his auto mechanic work. He is hoping to generate more income and to save for his future. He is very grateful for this opportunity!

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck and new tools for his auto mechanic work.

loans.name: Nelis Nohemy

texts.es:
La  señora Nelis de 35 años, vive con su esposo  en su casa de habitación en una colonia de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10  años a la venta de hamacas de hilo, hamacas de seda, sondalezas, mecates, cabuyas, hamacas de cabuyas etc.
Doña Nelis su negocio está ubicado en la orilla de la carretera panamericana, sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y pesonas que transitan por por la zona que le visitan de diferentes partes.
Doña Nelis está solicitando  el préstamo  para compra de más hamacas de seda, hilo, mecates, cabuyas, sondalezas, etc. para así tener mas variedad de productos que ofrecer a todos sus clientes, quiere comprar al por mayor para la temporada de semana santa porque es la época que más vende. 
Doña Nelis su sueño ampliar su negocio y fortalecerlo.
 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Nelis is 35 years old. She lives with her husband in her house in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. For 10 years she has been selling silk hammocks, thread hammocks, ropes, cords, pita fibers, pita fiber hammocks, etc.

Nelis's business is located on the edge of the Panamerican highway. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and people who are traveling in the area who are visiting from elsewhere.  

Nelis is asking for the loan to buy more hammocks made from silk, thread, cord, pita fiber, rope, etc., so she can have a wider variety of products to offer all of her customers. She wants to buy wholesale for the Holy Week season because that is when her sales are the highest.

Nelis' dream is to expand her business and fortify it.
 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February, 2013.

loans.use: to buy hammocks made from silk, thread, cord, pita fibers, rope, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store. Her loan was also a big help in the education of her children. She also has an Internet Cafe which is where she wanted to focus on. She has been in this business for eight years now and it is continuously growing. She and her husband, who is a barangay (village) captain are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Grace dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Vano

texts.en:
Vano is 47 years old. He lives in a small village near the Gardabani District with his wife and five children. Vano has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but has had no success. His loan requests were always rejected, due to his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is trading. In particular, Vano purchases iron at wholesale prices and then resells at a higher price. However, it is hardly enough to pay for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vano requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved within the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the received credit Vano will purchase a milking cow so the family can produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Vano's family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 66-year-old married woman and the mother of two grown children. She lives with her family in Loon, Bohol, in the Philippines. Erlinda has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 15 years now.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Erlinda hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en: Presentacion, who is 52 years old, is married with three children. She has had a fish-selling business for nearly 10 years. This business enables her to earn an income of PHP 1,000 weekly. She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish to sell such as tilapia and bangus (milkfish). She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fish such as tilapia and bangus (milkfish) to sell.

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Maribel tiene 50 años de edad, acompañada con tres hijos de 3, 18, 22 años de edad respectivamente, tiene 28 años dedicarse  a  la venta de verduras, frutas frescas y nacatamales, de ser clientes con la institución tiene 3 años respectivamente, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, frutas frescas como naranjas, piñas, guayaba para frescos, remolachas, zanahorias, mandarinas, jocotes, mangos, papaya, tamarindos, limón, banano, y materia prima para hacer nacatamales como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, arroz, papas, vegetales, naranja agria, mecates, sal, etc. Cindy tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio y Juana tiene 66 años de edad y su negocio es tener un pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Maribel. She is 50 years old, married and has three children aged 3, 18 and 22. For 28 years she has been selling vegetables, fresh fruit and nacatamales. They have all been clients of the institution for 3 years each. Maribel will invest the loan in buying fresh fruit such as oranges, pineapples and guayaba for juices, as well as beets, carrots, tangerines, jocotes, mangos, papayas, tamarinds, lemons, bananas, and ingredients to make nacatamales such as pork, banana leaves, rice, vegetables, tart oranges, string, salt, etc. 

Cindy is 20 years old and her business is a convenience store in her house and Juana is 66 and her business is a small sewing workshop.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit such as oranges, pineapples, and guayabas for juices as well as beets, carrots, tangerines, jocotes, mangos, papayas, tamarinds, lemons, bananas,beets and ingredients to make nacatamales such as pork, banana leaves, rice, potatoes, vegetables, tart oranges, string, salt, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Bautista Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER BAUTISTA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida y dulces, elaboración de prendas de vestir, venta de salchipapas, tejido de buzos de lana, tejido de mantas a máquina.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mery es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida y dulces; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de paquetes de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras  mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializara en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones en crédito.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO AMANECER BAUTISTA” community bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors where Mery is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them we have: selling vegetables, selling food and candies, making clothing, selling salchipapas, knitting wool sweaters, machine knitting blankets. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-businesswomen, including Mery. She says that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of a consultant from the institution who visited her at her home. Right now, she has a business selling food and candies. She says that she learned this business on her own.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying packs of candy wholesale that she will acquire from wholesalers. Later she will sell them from her locale. This work allows her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, because she is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health portion and the credit trainings.

loans.use: to buy packs of candy wholesale.

loans.name: Lenchonghoi Lom Group

texts.en:
Chongboi says, “To raise five kids without a regular income is challenging when your husband serves as a pastor in a small village church.” Chongboi narrates the hardship she faces in managing the family's affairs. Chongboi is the featured borrower member of the Lenchonghoi Group. She is featured with her hand raised. She shares that it is lucky to be married to a pastor but not so lucky when it comes to running the family. 

Chongboi joined Lenchonghoi Group in the year 2009 and started earning money by engaging herself in piggery. Chongboi uses piggery as a main source of income for the family. She sells the fully grown pigs and then buys new piglets again to raise them. She is well experienced in piggery technique now. She sells the fully grown pigs in the village and neighbouring villages. She provides school fees, text-books, school uniforms, and study materials for all the five children and now she aspires to start a poultry business with a new loan.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy chicks and construct a chicken coop. She will ask her fellow member friend to teach her the practices to raise chickens (her friend's poultry is shown in the group photograph). She is excited and looking forward to the next loan. She sends all the lenders good wishes and thanks you.

The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, weaving, poultry and ginger farming. All the other members are also very hard working women and strive hard to lead an independent life.

loans.use: To pay for chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel's Group

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 33-year-old carpenter and a dry-land farmer. His carpentry business is inhibited by not having sufficient capital to buy timber and better tools. Emmanuel says, "I like doing tree farming and KOMAZA is helping farmers to realize their dream." With the profits from his KOMAZA tree farm, he plans to improve his workshop and buy modern tools.

loans.use: to buy eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizers and pay for training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarsaikhan, who is 45 years old, lives with her husband and younger daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband had a stroke and receives a disability pension from the state. Her daughter goes to a secondary high school. 

Bayarsaikhan has been running her clothing-sales business since 2009. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to import clothes from China. As a result, she will be able to continue running her business without worrying about an inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to import clothes from China.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her hog-raising business.

Gina has been in this business for seven years. Gina earns additional income from a general store.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of buying a motorcycle to be used for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife and he works in agricultural from tradition. To support his family, he works hard. 

He raises cows and he sells milk in his neighborhood. In this way he earns a living. Fadil is able to support his family through his business. He also works with his tractor on agricultural land which he has possessed for a long time. 

Fadil now needs a loan to buy a cutting machine for his tractor. With the help of this loan he can facilitate his work. He hopes to keep on making his own living in order not to ask for help from others. Fadil wants to thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy a cutting machine for the tractor.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung was born in 1945. She has two children who are adults and have their own families. She is a widow. Dung is retired and now raises chickens to earn a living. Her income is about 2,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy baby chicks to raise.

loans.use: to buy baby chicks to raise.

loans.name: Dich

texts.en:
Dich was born in 1953. She has five children who have their own families. She is a widow. 

Dich is a farmer to earn a living. She has done this job for 35 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle, she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy food for her fish, baby chicks, and piglets. When she has profits, she wants to enlarge her business by buying more fish and pig to raise.

loans.use: to buy food for her fish, baby chicks, and piglets.

loans.name: Entusa

texts.es:
Entusa, de 61 años de edad ,es una mujer sencilla y bondadosa. Vive en compañía de Julio, su esposo ,ambos tienen 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con Antonia, la menor de ellas en la casa que heredó de sus padres.   
Ella es una mujer mayor, junto a su esposo trabajan las tierras que lograron adquirir gracias a su esfuerzo. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz, habas, cebada y alverja. Los que fertilizan, riegan y extraen , desde las primeras horas del día, hasta el último rayo del sol. En cada cosecha y con el apoyo de sus hijos, trasladan los alimentos a la ciudad mas cercana, donde la comercializan en el mercado principal. Asimismo posee cerdos y ovejas, que alimenta para su propio consumo, más las 2 vacas que posee, producen la leche que consume, de esa manera sostiene su alimentación. Su mayor deseo es seguir sembrando,  por ello juntará más capital de trabajo para asi seguir sembrando aun en más cantidad. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio ,por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas .Entusa, invertirá los S/. 500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues dentro de algunos meses cosechará maíz.
texts.en:
Entusa, 61, is a simple and generous woman. She lives in a house she inherited from her parents, together with Julio, her husband, and Antonia, the youngest of her nine children.

Entusa is now in an advanced age and works with her husband the land they bought with effort. Their main crops are corn, beans, barley and peas, and they fertilize, water and harvest them starting early in the morning and finishing with the last ray of sunlight. Every season, helped by their children, they transport the produce to the closest city, where they sell them in the main marketplace. Entusa also raises pigs and sheep for her own consumption and has two cows that produce the milk she drinks; this is how she ensures her food provision.

Entusa’s biggest dream is to continue growing these crops and expand her plantations, and this is why she wants to gather enough working capital. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for this opportunity to improve her business. She promises to pay her installments on time.

Entusa will invest the 500 soles [PEN] in buying compost to nurture her land, because in a few months, she will harvest corn.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, 58 years old, is married to a farmer and they were blessed with five children. 

She has managed a piggery business in their village for almost five years. When she sells the pigs, she earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. 

She would like a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feeds. Her income is always spent on their household expenditures, so she's hoping to obtain her loan to maintain her piggery business in a progressive way.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina, 29, is a married woman and a mother of two young children. She is from the town of Antequera, Bohol.  

Nina has been engaged in basket weaving for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. Nina works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

As of this time, Nina is applying for a loan to buy additional materials for basket weaving like buri (native palm), wicker, straw and others. With this, she will be able to produce more baskets, thus allowing her to sell more in the market. In the future, Nina hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for basket weaving like buri, wicker, straw and others.

loans.name: Jamale

texts.en: Jamale is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her only working child. She’s a friendly and above all, hardworking woman. And since she’s the one responsible for covering the family expenses, she started her own business in 2003.  She’s well known in her area and works from home. She possesses residences and stores and receives the monthly rental charges for them. In order to provide the family with extra financial support, her husband works outside the country. With her requested loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l, she will renovate an apartment that will be rented soon. She is very optimistic and ambitious to open her own rental office as soon as she can, hoping to attract additional customers and enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to renovate an apartment to be rented

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 51 years old. She lives in the small village of the Sachkhere district with husband and two sons. 

Manana has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Manana’s husband and son are working as truck drivers and get a small monthly income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as high risk borrowers because of low income. 

With the received credit, Manana will purchase a milking cow and sheep. After purchasing the livestock, Manana will be able to produce dairy products for selling. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow and sheep.

loans.name: Chan Sultan

texts.en: Chan Sultan is a 52 years old hardworking women living with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. They have three buffalo and her husband sells the buffalo milk to their neighbors and other people, which is the only source of income for their family. She wants to sell milk, yogurt and butter in the market on a larger scale, therefore, production needs to be increased.  Chan Sultan is facing a very difficult time as her monthly income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a new buffalo in order to increase the production of milk and increase her monthly income. With the profit she is planning to send her children to school. She is very hopeful that the loan will profitably impact the business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina, 48 years of age, is married to a government employee and blessed with four children. 

She has a direct selling business in which she sells personal use products in their village. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 2,500 monthly. 

She would like a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase talc powder, lotions, lipsticks, deodorants, and body spray. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will improve more and become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase talc powder, lotions, lipsticks, deodorants, and body spray.

loans.name: Zarmeen

texts.en:
Zarmeen is a 32-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two daughters and one son. All the three children are studying in schools. 

Her husband is a laborer and his income is insufficient to pay the school fees of the children and meet the household expenses. Zarmeen is helping her husband by selling milk, yogurt, and butter from her home to other people in the suburbs.  

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of loan is that she would buy milk and other dairy products from the village in large quantity and then sell it in the city for a profit. With the profit amount, she would pay the school fee of her children and save some money for the future. 

She dreams of having her own house. She wants to live a happy peaceful life with her family and this loan can fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products from the village to sell in the city.

loans.name: Vijoleta

texts.en:
Vijoleta is single and living in a Roma community. She lives in the southern part with her entire family. Her father is musician who performs for weddings and other celebrations in his area. His income is the main source for the family and is not enough to cover the family's daily expenses and much-needed home renovations. 

The family's house is extremely old and in poor condition, which exposes the family to unsanitary and unhealthy living conditions. Vijoleta is requesting a loan for the renovation of the kitchen and rooms. The loan will help to ensure healthier and improved living conditions for her family. She is very  grateful to Kiva lenders for helping to improve her family's conditions and standard of living!

loans.use: To renovate the kitchen and other rooms.

loans.name: Asia Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 32-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along her husband, one daughter and a son. Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Both of her children are studying in government schools. 

Asia is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010 she has been operating her own beauty salon. Currently, the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished, and therefore Asia wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. 

As a member of a six-person lending group, she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other variety of products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the profit, she will pay the installments of the loan and school fees for her children. She dreams to live a happy healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture Asia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase products for beauty salon.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 32 year old, diligent and hardworking women living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and three daughters. Her husband is a government employee and all of her children are currently studying at school. Her husband’s monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses. They are living in a rented house and she desires to have her own house, as they have to pay very high rent every month. Ruqia helps her husband by selling cloth for the last three years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to buy new varieties of cloth and expand her business by opening a small boutique in the market. With the profit she wants to pay the educational expenses of her children and save some money for the future. Ruqia is very hopeful that the loan would be a productive one for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: Buy new varieties of cloth

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia, de 29 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Gido y su pequeño hijo, al que cuidan en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años. Su principal ingreso económico lo obtiene de las costuras manuales que realiza, las cuales cuida con mucha dedicación y arte desde hace 6 años, confiesa que para ello tiene un propio capital de trabajo que le ayuda a progresar en este negocio. Pero como es una mujer hábil y con aspiraciones, desea aprovechar sus tiempos libres en otro negocio, por lo que hace 6 meses abrió una tienda de comestibles en la puerta principal de su casa. Gracias al inicio de clases, vendió muy bien, pues su tienda se ubica muy cerca de un colegio y muchos de ellos compran los alimentos en la tienda que abrió y a la que quiere mejorar para obtener más ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad que le brindan, ya que podrá mejorar su negocio ,por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Herminia, invertirá S/.1000 soles en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche, fideos y demás bebidas.
texts.en:
Herminia is 29 years old and is a hard working woman. She lives with her husband Gido and their small child who they have been raising in a rented home for two years. The primary income is received from manual seamstress work that she carries out with great care and artistry for six years now. She admits that she does have working capital that helps her to progress with her business. But since she is a skilled woman with aspirations, she chooses to take advantage of her free time in another business. 

Six months age she opened a store selling foodstuffs in the main entrance of her home. Thanks to the beginning of the school year she has made good sales. Her store is close to a high school and many of them purchase food in the store that she opened. She hopes to improve her earnings with the business. 

This is her second Kiva loan and is thankful for the opportunity brought forth because she will be able to improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her loan installments. Herminia will invest S./ 1000 soles to purchase basic needs products including rice, sugar, boxes of milk, noodles and drinks.

loans.use: to buy products including rice, sugar, milk, noodles and others.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
Don José tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos  y vive en el Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.
El señor José tiene una pulpería, el inicio este negocio con capital propio y  ofrece productos de la canasta básica como harina, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, maseca, productos de abarrotería, carnes, lácteos etc. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable, los productos tienen bastante demanda.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio con productos que tiene mayor demanda como arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina etc. Considera que con esta inversión sus ventas aumentaran y ofrecerá variedad de productos a los clientes.
Su meta es ampliar más el negocio y darles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en: Jose is 43 years old. He is married and has two children and lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Jose has a grocery store. He started this business with his own money and offers basic products like flour, beans, rice, sugar, butter, grocery products, meats, dairy, etc. This business has been very profitable for him. The products have quite a bit of demand. Currently, he has requested a loan of 12,000 lempiras to stock his business with products that have greater demand such as rice, beans, butter, flour etc. He considers that with this investment, his sales will increase and he will offer product variety to his customers. His goal is to expand his business more and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase food products like rice, beans, butter, flour, etc. to stock the business.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 52 year old housewife. She lives with her husband and nine children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2002, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. Due to their large family and low monthly income they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can invest in her husband’s shop.

With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of goods like rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for a better future of their children. The profit will be used to expand the business and pay the household expenses.

Rasheeda and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for their family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her general store

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and lives in Tukuran ZDS. She is married with 4 children.

Nida has a shop that sells food and she has been working at this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy meat.

Nida has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Nida hopes to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.
Doña Maria atiende su propio negocio de pulpería. Este negocio lo estableció en su casa hace 3 años, con el propósito de generar un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del  hogar. Ella vende productos de la canasta básica como arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina, pollo, refrescos. Comenta que con a ayuda de los financiamientos a podido mantener estable el negocio.
Ella solicito otro préstamo para comprar y surtir la pulpería con productos de mayor demanda como frijoles, arroz, maseca, harina, pollo, lácteos etc. Con estas ventas espera mejorar las ganancias.
La meta que tiene es remodelar su casa y darle mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Maria manages her own grocery business. She established this business in her house three years ago with the goal of generating income to help her husband with bills at home. She sells basic necessity products like rice, beans, butter, flour, chicken, beverages. She comments that with the help of the loans, she has been able to keep her business stable. She requested another loan to buy and stock her store with products that are in greater demand like beans, rice, corn flour, flour, chicken, dairy, etc. With these sales, she hopes to improve her earnings. Her goal is to remodel her house and give greater comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy basic products like beans, rice, corn flour, flour, chicken, dairy, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Frecheil

texts.en:
Frecheil is a 32 year old married woman and a mother of three children ages 10, 8 and 6. Frecheil runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various items and goods.
Frecheil is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to improve her sales and income. In the future, Frecheil hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Soberanas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOBERANAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Zonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, comerciante de ropa, venta de láminas escolares, venta de ganado, tejido de chompas, venta de verduras. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Zonia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chamarras; da a conocer que hace mas de ocho años ella apoyaba en el taller de costura de sus hermanos, de esa experiencia aprendió la técnica de costura por ello decide abrir su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las empresas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella está casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todas las capacitaciones.

En la fotografía la asesora de crédito acompaña al grupo, ella es Elizabeth y esta ubicada en la ventana.
texts.en:
The Soberanas communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It is comprised of seven members, and it is overseen by a board of directors.  Zonia is the president.  The members are involved in various businesses, including making jackets [sewing], selling clothes, selling school supplies [informational poster like sheets], selling livestock, knitting sweaters, and selling vegetables.

Their loan will benefit small business people like Zonia.  She has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who visited Zonia at her house.  She currently has a business making jackets.  She says that over eight years ago she helped in her siblings’ sewing shop.  From this experience she learned the technique of sewing.  Therefore, she decided to open her own workshop.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy fabric.  She will get the fabric from the companies in the city of La Paz.  After she makes the jackets, she will sell them by order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources in order to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes all of the trainings.

Elizabeth, the loan officer, accompanied the group in the photo.  She is in the window.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Kiminu 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Eric, aged 36, is single with an 18 year old son. His son is currently attending school. He is representing the Kiminu 2 (1) group. Eric sells clothing in a local market. He has been operating this business for 10 years. He will use the loan to buy more clothing, including jeans, shirts, polos, and shoes. His business strategy is to sell good quality clothing. His customers know they can trust his merchandise. 
Eric has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to have a large clothing store in the future. He hopes his son continues his education and goes to college.

loans.use: to pay for imported clothing

loans.name: Johnmil

texts.en:
This is Johnmil, 22, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. He is still single and he lives with his parents. He helps them in managing their household since he also works to help his family.

Johnmil has a buy-and-sell business and he is selling silver, in particular. He has necklaces, earrings, and rings. Aside from his buy-and-sell business, he also has a repair shop. His customers are the people in his community and those who are fond of silver accessories. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Johnmil is requesting an amount of PHP 8,000 in his loan. He will use it to buy more silver products needed in his business.

Johnmil dreams to have a new outlet and hopes that his siblings will finish their studies. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more silver needed in his business.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.es:
Silvano  tiene 22 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Silvano se dedica a la agricultura hace 4 años cultiva café, el cual comercializa en el mercado local. El precio de este producto es rentable y de allí ha podido sacar los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Esta solicitando su tercer préstamo de 13,000 lempiras, el cual utilizara para la compra de fertilizante y darle asistencia necesaria a su finca. Espera mejorar sus cultivos y ofrecer calidad de producto a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir obteniendo ingresos para ayudar a su hijo.
texts.en: Silvano is 22 years old, he is married, has one child and lives in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua. Silvano has been dedicated to farming for four years. He plants coffee, which he sells in the local market. The price of this product is profitable and from that he has been able to take the income to help his family. He is requesting his third loan of 13,000 lempiras which he will use to buy fertilizer and give needed assistance to his farm. He hopes to improve his crops and offer product quality to his customers. His goal is to keep obtaining income to help his son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Mirlind

texts.en:
Mirlind is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his family. Mirlind is a very ambitious person who wants to improve the living conditions for himself and his family. He is planning to start his own business - a car wash. He considers this business profitable because there is not a high initial investment and a lot of demand.
In Kosovo this business is required because every day there are consumers who need these kinds of services.
Mirlind requests a loan to purchase a car wash pressure washer. In the future he wants to increase the capacity of his business, so they can satisfy clients and meet the demand for car washes and in this way gain more interested clients. He is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a car wash pressure washer

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a married Iraqi client, who is 43 years old and has 3 children. Kasem is the sole provider for his family.
Kasem owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juice, cheese, dairy products, detergent, snacks and canned food. He established his business in 2000. He has experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Kasem is requesting a sum of $1,800 to renovate his shop by installing new shelves on the walls, and also to increase his food inventory. Kasem is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide a good future for his children.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing new shelves on the walls, and also to increase his food inventory

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a 41-year-old Iraqi married man, who has 6 children. Mouhammad is a grocer and he works hard to provide for his family.
In his grocery store, Mouhammad sells shampoo, detergent, dairy products, soft drinks and snacks. In 2000, he took over his father’s business and since then he has been working at this business and providing his living from it. He has experience in this field and is well known in his neighborhood.
Mouhammad is requesting a loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to renovate his shop to attract more customers. He hopes, through this renovation, that his business will grow more so he will be able to satisfy his children’s needs and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en: Zaher is from Iraq. He is 52 years old, married, and the father of five children. Zaher and his wife run a grocery store together. They have various products to offer, such as snacks, detergents, drinks and dairy products. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained a good reputation;  he is the only grocer in the neighborhood. Zaher is applying for a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and also to buy a motor generator. He aims to increase his food inventory and also his income, so that he may provide his family better with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to install a display window and buy a motor generator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mainor Danilo

texts.es:
Mainor  tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y hermanos en El Municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Mainor  se dedica desde hace 4 años a la agricultura, específicamente al  cultivo del café. El café lo vende en pergamino en el mercado local, este negocio le es rentable, el precio del café se mantiene y le da los ingresos necesarios para aportar con los gastos del hogar.
Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo de 15,000 lempiras que lo invertirá para comprar fertilizante. Con esta inversión ayudara a mantener sus cultivos con buena asistencia  libres de toda plaga. Así podrá seguir vendiendo y ofreciendo el café de buena calidad.
Su meta es mantener la finca de café en buen estado y mantener una buena producción en las cosechas.
texts.en:
Mainor is 22 years old and single. He lives with his mother and siblings in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.

Mainor has worked for four years in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee. He sells the pergamino coffee in the local market. This business is profitable. The price of coffee remains steady and provides him the necessary income to contribute to home expenses.

He is requesting his third loan of 15,000 Lempiras, which he will invest in the purchase of fertilizer. With this investment, he will help to maintain his crops with good assistance free from all plagues. Thus, he will be able to continue selling and offering good-quality coffee.

His goal is to maintain the coffee farm in good condition and maintain a good crop production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en: Feride is a 53-year-old married woman with seven grown children. She lives in the south. Her husband is a pensioner, and Feride works in agriculture to earn a living and provide for family needs. Because there is demand in the neighborhood, she has started to sell milk and milk products to others in her community. She has been selling fresh milk to the local dairy farm and has made a good living, and profits, from this so far. To generate even more income, she has applied for a loan to buy another cow. In the future, she plans to add more cows and to increase her business and milk production. She is aware that without Kiva’s, support her goal will be difficult to achieve. She appreciates all the support from the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Kiminu 2 (2) Group

texts.en: Kalixe, age 38, is married and has three children, ages 7 to 15. All of his children are attending school. He is representing the Kiminu 2 (2) group. Kalixe has two different small businesses, which he has had for two years. He makes and sells foufou (a traditional African food) and peanut butter. He also has a small pharmacy where he sells various medicines. He will use this loan to buy medicine to stock his pharmacy. His business strategy is to provide friendly customer service and treat his customers well. This is Kalixe's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and Kalixe’s group are confident in his ability to pay back the loan. He hopes his children will continue with their education and progress in life.

loans.use: to pay for medicine to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Darlyn Marleny

texts.es:
Darlyn tiene24 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus hijo en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.
Darlyn atiende su negocio de pulpería. Ella vende productos alimenticios como harina, maseca, frijoles, azúcar, carnes, y productos de abarrotería. Ha trabajado desde pequeña y creció con la convicción de ten tener su su propio negocio.
Solicito un préstamo de 7,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de productos alimenticios para surtir la pulpería y ofrecer variedad de producto.
La meta que tiene es incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Darlyn is 24 years old, is a single mother and lives with her son in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbará.

Darlyn attends to her grocery store.  She sells food products like flour, corn flour, sugar, meats and other grocery products.  She has worked since she was young and grew up with the goal of having her own business.

She requested a loan of 7,000 lempiras to invest in buying food products to supply her grocery store and offer a variety of products.

The goal she has is to to increase her income and improve her son's life.

loans.use: to buy food products to supply her business

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Adjovi  est mariée à un employé au Port Autonome de Lomé. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de charbons de bois, des ignames, du haricot et autres. Elle a démarré ses activités en 2002 et s’approvisionne au Nord du pays. Elle demande un troisième prêt pour acheter de nouveaux sacs de charbons de bois et les autres produits. Madame Adjovi espère avec les profits porter une aide aux enfants de ses frères et se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Adjovi, age 33, is married to an employee of the Autonomous Port of Lomé. Her business consists in selling charcoal, yams, beans, and other products.

She started her business in 2002, and gets her supplies in the north of the country. She's seeking her third loan to buy sacks of charcoal and other products.

With her profits, Mrs. Adjovi hopes to provide for herself and help the children of her brothers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, yams, and tapioca

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 33-year-old Iraqi client who is married and has three children. Fadel is the sole provider of the family.

Fadel is a grocer. He offers to sell various products like shampoos, detergents, snacks, dairy products, and drinks. He has been in this field since 2010 and has good experience in what he practices since he previously worked in a similar shop, as an employee. Fadel is well-known in his surroundings, thanks to his good behavior with his clients.

Fadel is requesting a loan of USD 1,200. He will use this loan to install a second ceiling and a new floor and increase his inventory. With this loan, he aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a second ceiling and a new floor and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow and calf

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh is married, 31 years old, and the father of three children. He also shares his home with his parents and his brother, and he and his brother are the family's breadwinners. Hamzeh works hard at a bakery which he opened last year. He has wide experience in this field because he used to work in a bakery before he went into business on his own. His business grew fast and his reputation spread all over the neighborhood. He now has three employees who work for him. He is requesting a loan for $2,400 to renovate his bakery, install a new rolling shutter and new signs. Hamzeh believes that this loan will help him improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Flor De Canela 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CANELA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marciala es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de chamarras, venta de comida, venta de papa, venta de arroz.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marciala es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una Jefa de Centro de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde apoyaba en la cocina, posteriormente con mayor experiencia y con los recursos decide emprender su propio negocio en el rubro de la comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina broster) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Flor de Canela” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Office. It is made up of twelve members and is directed by a board of directors of which Marciala is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association pursue are varied. Included among them are: a neighborhood store, and various sales in sweets, coats, food, potatoes, and rice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro-businesses of which Marciala is a member. She indicates that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, joining through the invitation of a Central Manager of the institution. Currently, she has a food-sales business. She states that she launched this business from a previous job where she provided support in the kitchen. Subsequently, with greater experience and with the resources she decided to start her own business in the food industry.

The loan that she will now take out is for the increase of capital (to purchase a Broaster roasting machine) that she will acquire from the wholesale merchants in the city of La Paz and subsequently install it in her workspace. This type of work permits her to generate an income to maintain her home in all possible ways; she is married and has eight children.

When consulted about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health and loan trainings.

loans.use: to buy a Broaster roasting machine.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, de 34 años de edad es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Fortunato, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en los terrenos agrícolas, aprendió a producir la tierra y tiene mucho conocimiento sobre los temas agrícolas, pero según comenta se estableció en el pueblo y dejó de sembrar de manera constante, “Siembro alimentos para mi consumo, de esa forma me alimento de manera natural”, afirma.  Pero comenzó con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado como: vacas, cerdos y ovejas, las cuales engorda para ensebarlos posteriormente, “no solo los engordo, también los nutro con buen pasto y comida balanceada para que tengan buena carne y cuesten más”, es por eso que siembra alfalfa en sus terrenos agrícolas de mayor extensión, donde produce pastos naturales para el consumo de sus animales. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA y promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Faustina, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, ya que dentro de poco comenzará la temporada de escasez de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Faustina, who is 34 years old, is an unassuming woman. She lives with her husband, Fortunato, with whom she has three children, whom she cares for in the house that they bought 10 years ago. She began to work on the agricultural lands when she was very young. She learned to cultivate the land, and she has a lot of knowledge of agricultural subjects, but as she commented, she settled in the town and stopped planting continually. "I plant food for my use. In this way I feed myself in a natural manner," she states. But she began a business of buying and selling animals such as cows, pigs, and sheep, which she fattens to sell later. "I not only fatten them, I also nourish them with good grass and balanced feed so that they have good meat and sell for more." It is for this reason that she plants alfalfa on her largest areas of agricultural land, where she produces natural pasturelands for the consumption of her animals.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Faustina will invest the 500 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her plantings, since the season when alfalfa is scarce will begin soon.

loans.use: to buy organic compost for her pasturelands.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda earns a living through her sari-sari store (variety store) by selling various goods and items to the people in her town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than eight years now and she works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

Leonarda is applying for a loan to buy additional stocks of goods like canned food, rice, noodles, snacks, beverages, detergents and toiletries. With her loan, she will be able to attract and cater for more customers, thus improving her sales and income. In the future, Leonarda hopes to make her business a profitable success.
